title: Steve Rule
text:
Stephen "Steve" Rule (born 5 June 1952) is an English-born former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1970s and 1980s, and current rugby union <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a>. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for <a href="English%20Universities%20Rugby%20Union">English Universities Rugby Union</a> and <a href="Cheshire%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Cheshire Rugby Football Union</a>, and at club level for <a href="Loughborough%20Students%20RUFC">Loughborough Students RUFC</a> and <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Fly-half">fly-half</a>, i.e. number 10, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a> and <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> (<a href="List%20of%20St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">Heritage No. 961</a>), as a , i.e. number 1, and coached representative level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Cheshire%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Cheshire Rugby Football Union</a>, and at club level for <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale</a>, <a href="Lymm%20RFC">Lymm RFC</a>, <a href="New%20Brighton%20F.C.%20%28rugby%20union%29">New Brighton</a> and <a href="Macclesfield%20RUFC">Macclesfield RUFC</a>.
Background.
Steve Rule was born in <a href="Bebington">Bebington</a>, <a href="Cheshire">Cheshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
International honours.
Steve Rule won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> (RL) while at Salford in 1981, qualifying through his grandparents who were born in <a href="Aberdare">Aberdare</a>.
Rugby union achievements.
Steve Rule won the <a href="British%20Universities%20and%20Colleges%20Sport">Universities Athletic Union</a>, <a href="Old%20Belvedere">Old Belvedere</a>, <a href="Bridgend%20Ravens">Bridgend</a> and <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow</a> <a href="Rugby%20sevens">Rugby sevens</a> tournaments with <a href="Loughborough%20Students%20RUFC">Loughborough Students RUFC</a> in 1973, and represented <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20union%20in%20Bermuda">Bermuda Classic Tournament</a> in 1989.
Career records.
Until extended to 14-goals by <a href="Steve%20Blakeley">Steve Blakeley</a> in 2003, Steve Rule jointly held Salford's "Most goals in a game" record with 13-goals scored against <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster</a> on 4 September 1981, with <a href="Gus%20Risman">Gus Risman</a> and <a href="David%20Watkins%20%28rugby%29">David Watkins</a>.
Outside of rugby.
Steve Rule retired from playing rugby in 1985 following a neck injury, and currently works as Head of the Pupil Referral Service at <a href="Metropolitan%20Borough%20of%20Wigan">Wigan Council</a>.
